title: Death's Dance is going to go the way of WotA
body:
It doesn't fulfill the fantasy.
It provides an insane amount of LS AND SpV.
It has very good AD slot and cost efficiency
Every other stat about it is mediocre or shit.

If you get down to brass tacks, old WotA had an aura. New WotA had...80 AP, 10 cdr, 20% SpV. Gee, that combo seems familiar, doesn't it? DD is physical WotA. That's it. The passive isn't interactive, and that's supposed to be the selling point.

If the passive is not healthy for the game in any substantial form, then you might as well just remove it from the stat budget and let DD have better slot efficiency

replies.body: Who are you looking to build it on?  Not all champions view items in equal terms to eachother.

The only two champions I find it decent on are Pantheon and Renekton for obvious reasons, but I would rather build BC, Maw, or Hydra on both of them. I could get on board with a hyped up passive that blocks 50% damage and then deals 150% of the blocked damage over 3-5 seconds, but as it stands, DD is basically an item that gives sustain that is useful on AD casters and a moderate amount of burst resistance.

If I want sustain, I'll get Hydra.
If I want CDR, I'll get BC or Maw.
If I want general tankiness, I'll get BC
If I want burst resistance, I'll get Maw.
I want CDR, lots of AD, sustain, and general tankiness...wtf am I, high? There shouldn't be an item that does that all together to a decent degree. I'll just get some overlap with BC, Maw, Hydra, Randuin's, and SV.

My beef with the item is that it doesn't really have a good niche because the intended niche is so weak. It could be a really good high-risk, high-reward item, but it isn't. I have died more times to DFT than to the passive on DD even when controlling for the frequency of encountering them. There is no dancing with death like the pitch was. It's just a stat stick that does a shittier job of Maw and Hydra.

I can't say anything for Pantheon, havent played him.  Tried it on Renekton with mixed results so I think I'm not picking my situations correctly.

Darius looks like the best contender for Deaths Dance with his bleed stacks and natural wave clear followed perhaps by Illaoi.  With the aoe they both provide you could easily pass up Hydra.

BC > DD for Darius. And once you have BC, now you need some defense like Randuin's or Dead Man's. The same really applies for Illaoi. It's not so much the stats are bad as other items have the same or slightly worse but have a much stronger niche.

Another good contender it has to fight for is {{item:3053}}, which has the same sort of niche (honestly the exact same niche) just with less raw AD and more tankiness. I've never built it on Pantheon because it doesn't contribute to bonus AD ratio damage, but it's very common on both Illaoi and Darius and I've built it a few times on Renekton.

Again, I can't exactly think of a situation in which I couldn't deal with it better with a different item or another item combination.

Could I trouble you to help me wrap my head around something then?

Maybe its just me but I cant help but feel like the Black Cleaver is kinda wasted stats on Darius.  Don't get me wrong, I understand that your bleed stacks it and that it helps cut down tanks but that's kinda why I don't like the idea of the item.  Darius' E already gives some armor penetration and tanks don't seem like they need the extra focus to take down during a team fight.  On top of that the penetration you get from the Black Cleaver is 100% wasted in terms of benefiting Darius' ult since it will only ever deal true damage.  Would it not be more beneficial to ignore the tank, drive towards a much softer target with a Sheen proc and just gib the most threatening damage dealer?  Without consistent, threatening damage sources I cant imagine the enemy team could deal with the rest of the fight effectively.

Something like {{item:3812}}  and {{item:3078}}  with some defensive items is something I'd like to try if I can find some time for it.

It's the utility from cutting down any targets armor. It doesn't only benefit you, it benefits every physical damage your team deals. You have an easy time stacking it with your bleed, you might as well get it.
That and the MS boost is nice.

I don't know what you mean with 'fantasy'. Isn't the other passive, the one that makes damage dealt to you become a bleed over 3 seconds that fufills the 'fantasy'? It's somewhat of an effective damage reduction if you can lifesteal what was dealt to you. Probably worth more than 5% lifesteal you could get with a {{item:3072}}, depending on the champion.

Also, it gives a good amount of AD and a fair portion of cdr. 15% lifesteal is not insane at all. Lifesteal per se is shit though. You need a lot more damage to make it work.

Overall {{item:3812}} is a good niche item for AD casters that also use autos.

Think {{champion:420}}, {{champion:240}}, {{champion:114}}, {{champion:58}}, {{champion:121}}, {{champion:104}} . Hell, even {{champion:119}} can get away with building it.

It certainly has some hidden power there but the thing is: There are champions that build {{item:3812}}. WotA had Vlad.

BT is better than DD on squishies unless you want CDR, then it's a question of why do you have DD instead of Maw and why do you want CDR instead of more AS/crit?

Every other champion want BC, Hyrda, Maw, or Gauge first and will then build either another one of those items or a pure defensive item like Randuin's, BV, SV, DM, or even Redemption at this point.

Kha doesn't want it because Kha wants Lethality just like every other AD assassin. It is literally his last items because there is nothing else moderately decent. The passive is more or less negligible. The DR is nice, but the DoT might as well not be there. That was the selling point of the item. If you didn't put enough pressure, you'd die from the DoT. And in exchange, it would give you a boatload of offensive stats. Well, that ain't the case. It's not any higher than the top tier AD items and the DoT's damage is non-existent. In order for the DoT itself to register on your radar as something meaningful, the enemy has to deal somewhere in the avenue of 90% of your health instantly. That's stupid.

Honestly, it would just be better if you had a debuff that constantly dealt a % of the damage blocked while in combat as long as you were in combat or until you killed a unit over 5 seconds continuously, stacking. DD blocks 100 damage? You now take 100 true damage over 5 seconds. Wait, you got hit again and blocked another 100 damage? Now you're taking 200 damage over 5 seconds. The debuff just ramps up until you get out of combat or kill a unit. This is the item you DON'T want in a prolonged fight and instead want in picks and stuff. THAT'S a niche. Right now, it's a stat stick.
